sub_title: Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD
summary:
As a professional learning development specialist focusing on languages with 6 years of experience, I work with young adults and professionals in both academic and industrial settings. I support them to make better improvements in their work, not only in overcoming language barriers, but also in better understanding their roles and goals. I work on innovating teaching methods, I am also skilled in competency-based learning and development, training design, training needs analysis, developing training solutions, training evaluation and stakeholder management.

I completed a PhD in language teaching development to create a more effective model of language learning in Hungarian to help the integration of foreigners. As a certified language teacher and mentor, I seek to find the best ways to teach Hungarian language to real-life situations. 

I am experienced in working in offline, online and hybrid environments. I have a strong interest in innovation. 

In volunteer programmes, I also work as a coach and trainer coordinator with international communities, creating a platform for international doctoral students for their integration in Hungary. As the founder of the Talented Youth Workshop Association, I work on improving the supportive environment for young talented artists, finding the best trainers, organising skill-building workshops, summarising feedback and providing financial resources. 

I have experience working with a variety of partners in academic, scientific, industrial and cultural fields. I have excellent communication and organisational skills, I am enthusiastic, creative and results-oriented. I am also skilled in project management, stakeholder management, and managing and adapting to business change.

projects:
[{'title': 'Ambassador System at Association of Hungarian PhD and DLA Candidates (DOSZ)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': "Building an international community of PhD candidates in Hungary. In the last decade there is a rapidly growing number of international PhD candidates in Hungary: in the Association of Hungarian Phd and DLA Candidates (DOSZ), we are building a representation system, currently with 37 countries' ambassadors from 4 continents. We are organizing international programs, dealing with integration, cultural and language barriers, scientific cooperation, student representation and community budilding.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Norbert', 'last_name': 'Bencze', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD'}]}, {'title': 'Cultural Networks in Central Europe (Berlin)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Project-coordinator from ELTE, Budapest and lecturer.
The event was realized within the framework of CENTRAL, a cooperation between the Humboldt University of Berlin, the universities of Vienna and Warsaw, Charles University Prague as well as ELTE Budapest.
The main goal of the workshop was to explore and to document cultural networks in the Central European region. Each participating student presented research results concerning a cultural contact or network between their own country and Hungary over the last 30 years - such as scientific or artistic cooperations, adaptations in literature or art, creative activities beyond borders etc. This means that students from Berlin explored German-Hungarian networks, students from Warsaw Polish-Hungarian networks etc.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Norbert', 'last_name': 'Bencze', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD'}]}, {'title': 'Language and Culture in Language Teaching (Beijing)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Lecturer and workshop leader on a 2 days long methodological conference for teachers of Hungarian in China located at Beijing Foreign Studies University. Joint lectures with Katalin Szili for Hungarian teachers in China. 
Lectures and workshops held by me: 
- Grammar in the Process of Teaching Hungarian Studies
- Teaching Materials in Hungarian Studies', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Norbert', 'last_name': 'Bencze', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD'}]}, {'title': 'Hungarian Language in Theory and Practicw (Berlin, Warsaw, Prague, Budapest)', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Student, lecturer, Hungarian as a second language teacher.
The workshops took place in every year on an other university (Berlin, Warsaw, Prague, Budapest).
Main goals of the project:
1. Research collaboration between researchers and teachers of Hungarian studies
2. Mutual support of students’ final projects and dissertations in the field of Hungarian language and cultural studies as well as language education
3. Mutual enabling of supported teaching work placements for student teachers of Hungarian studies', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Norbert', 'last_name': 'Bencze', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Learning and Development Specialist  |  Talent Development Trainer  |  Academic and HR Education  |  Language Trainer  |  PhD'}]}]
